document.masterDocTitle: Species of the subgenus Minuspio (Polychaeta: Spionidae: Prionospio) from the southern coast of Turkey (Levantine Sea, eastern Mediterranean), with the description of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Species of the subgenus Minuspio (Polychaeta: Spionidae: Prionospio) from the southern coast of Turkey (Levantine Sea, eastern Mediterranean), with the description of two new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of the subgenus
Prionospio
(
Minuspio
)

paragraph.keyLead:
2 . Branchiae present from chaetiger 3 .....................................
Prionospio ( Minuspio ) pilkena
Wilson, 1990

3 . With dorsal flaps on chaetigers 5–13 ............................................
P. ( M. ) laciniosa
Maciolek, 1985

4 . Some branchia distinctly wrinkled..............................................
P. ( M. ) fauchaldi
Maciolek, 1985

7 . Interparapodial pouches present....................................................
P. ( M. ) aluta
Maciolek, 1985

8 . Ventral sabre chaeta absent....................................................
P. ( M. ) perkinsi
Maciolek, 1985
9 . Some branchia distinctly longer than (minimally 4–5 times) notopodial lamellae................................... 10
- All branchiae short, nearly as long as notopodial lamellae..................................................... 15

11 . Anterior part of prostomium truncated, with a small medial peak..........................
P. ( M. ) delta
Hartman, 1965

14 . Branchiae longest on chaetiger 2 , prostomium widest at mid–point.........................
P. ( M. ) tatura
Wilson, 1990

- Branchiae longest on chaetigers 4–5 , prostomium widest at posterior most region..............
P. ( M. ) yuriel
Wilson, 1990
- Notopodial lamellae more or less well–developed on chaetiger 1 ............................................... 19

18 . Anterior margin of prostomium truncated and with only a small peak.....................
P. ( M. ) wireni
Maciolek, 1985

- Anterior margin of prostomium rounded and with five small peaks...............
P. ( M. ) multibranchiata
Berkeley, 1927

21 . Eyes absent, branchiae wrinkled................................................
P. ( M. ) sandersi
Maciolek, 1981 b

- One or two pairs eyes present, branchiae narrow and cylindrical..........................
P. ( M. ) cirrifera
Wirén, 1883
